title: CATL announces its second European battery plant in Hungary
notes: I'm here to help! Please go ahead and share the data you've extracted from the articles, and I'll summarize the key information for you.

title: CATL to open $7.5bn battery plant in Debrecen, Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Debrecen, Hungary, within the Southern Industrial Park.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is 100 gigawatt hours (GWh).

Investment amounts:
- CATL has announced plans to invest €7.34bn ($7.49bn) in the project, making it the largest greenfield investment in Hungary’s history.

Project progress:
- Construction of the new site is subject to shareholder meeting approval and is expected to begin by the end of 2022.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, representing CATL's second battery factory in Europe.

Value chain stages:
- N/A

title: CATL Will Build Massive 100 GWh Battery Plant In Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The battery plant project is located in Debrecen, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the new battery plant is 100 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- Contemporary Amperex Technology Co., Limited (CATL) intends to invest €7.34 billion ($7.5 billion) in the construction of the 100 GWh EV battery plant in Hungary.

Project progress:
- The construction of the first production facilities is expected to start before the end of the year, pending approval at the shareholder meeting.

Project type:
- The project is a greenfield project, indicating that it will be constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The factory in Hungary will produce cells and modules for European automakers, covering the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

Additional Information:
- The factory will be powered by renewable electricity sources.
- The investment is expected to create up to 9,000 jobs.
- There is potential to establish facilities for battery materials in Europe, indicating the possibility of further CATL investments in the region.

title: CATL To Build $7.6 Billion 100 GWh Battery Factory In Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in the Southern Industrial Park in the city of Debrecen in Hungary.

Capacity:
- The annual production capacity of the battery factory is planned to increase from 170 GWh to 670 GWh by 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The project involves a new $7.6 billion battery factory in Hungary.

Project progress:
- The project has been announced and is planned to be located on 221 hectares in the Southern Industrial Park in Debrecen, Hungary. It aims to supply both cells and modules to European automakers. The project has received support from Hungarian officials and is part of the country's goal to attract state-of-the-art investments in the electromobility sector.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it involves the construction of a new battery factory from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, as it will supply both cells and modules to European automakers.

N/A

title: CATL’s New Battery Plant To Become Hungary’s Largest Greenfield FDI Project Ever
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Debrecen, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is 100 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- Contemporary Amperex Technology Co., Limited (CATL) will invest EUR 7.34 billion into the project.
- The investment is expected to create over 9,000 new jobs.

Project progress:
- Construction is scheduled to commence this year on 221 hectares in the Southern Industrial Park of Debrecen.
- The project is set to become Hungary’s largest FDI project ever and is expected to strengthen the country's role as one of the world’s leading battery producers.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with construction scheduled to commence this year.

Value chain stages:
- The project aims to establish facilities for battery materials in Europe to build a sustainable and circular battery value chain.

Note: The article does not provide specific information on the current operational status of the project.

title: CATL’s Record Volume Hungarian Project Formally Launched In Debrecen - VIDEO REPORT
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Debrecen, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is 100 GWh, making it the largest-ever greenfield project in Hungary. The current e-battery capacity in Hungary is 50 GWh, set to grow to 150 GWh by 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The investment for the project is EUR 7.34 billion, making it the biggest battery-related investment in the entire European Union. The magnitude of this investment nearly equals the total investment volume of the seven largest FDI deals guided by HIPA since 2014.

Project progress:
- The formal launch of the EUR 7.34 billion investment was marked by the signing of a document committing to purchase the relevant plot in Debrecen. The presale purchase agreement of the plot has been formally signed, indicating the project's initiation.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it is the largest-ever greenfield project in Hungary.

Value chain stages:
- N/A
